name: GitHubReleasePublish
description: Create and publish GitHub Release and upload assets, checking manifest content
author: Marcelo Forment√£o

inputs.name: githubEndpoint
inputs.label: GitHub Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the service endpoint for your GitHub connection. To create one, click the Manage link and create a new service endpoint.

inputs.name: manifestJson
inputs.label: Package.json
inputs.helpMarkDown: File from which default values will be extracted if options are missing.

inputs.name: githubRepository
inputs.label: Repository
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the GitHub repository. If empty, it will be extracted from package.json (the repository.url field).

inputs.name: githubTag
inputs.label: Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: Tag to release, value should be v$(Build.BuildNumber) for release current build, for example: v1.0.0. If empty, the version will be extracted from package.json and prepended by a 'v'.

inputs.name: githubReleaseTitle
inputs.label: Release title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Release title. If empty, it will be the same as the tag.

inputs.name: githubReleaseNotes
inputs.label: Release notes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Release notes. If empty, GitHub will use the last commit message.

inputs.name: githubReleaseAsset
inputs.label: File to upload as asset
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file to upload as artifacts to the release.
